name: v0.13.0
body:
## Using Bzlmod with Bazel 7

1. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_ruby", version = "0.13.0")
```

## Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6

1. Enable with `common --enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_ruby", version = "0.13.0")
```

## Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your `WORKSPACE.bazel` file:

```starlark
load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

# Skylib is a dependency, remove if you already have it.
http_archive(
    name = "bazel_skylib",
    sha256 = "74d544d96f4a5bb630d465ca8bbcfe231e3594e5aae57e1edbf17a6eb3ca2506",
    urls = [
        "https://mirror.bazel.build/github.com/bazelbuild/bazel-skylib/releases/download/1.3.0/bazel-skylib-1.3.0.tar.gz",
        "https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel-skylib/releases/download/1.3.0/bazel-skylib-1.3.0.tar.gz",
    ],
)

http_archive(
    name = "rules_ruby",
    sha256 = "a4b201ec10d22b48d709eec9ade44d540b91ef550e1eca75ec7e2a1eb56bad21",
    strip_prefix = "rules_ruby-0.13.0",
    url = "https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/releases/download/v0.13.0/rules_ruby-v0.13.0.tar.gz",
)
```


## What's Changed
* chore(deps): update dependency aspect_bazel_lib to v2.9.3 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/165
* chore(deps): update dependency bazel to v7.4.0 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/166
* feat: update supported Ruby versions by @p0deje in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/167


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/compare/v0.12.2...v0.13.0

## What's Changed
* chore(deps): update dependency bazel_gazelle to v0.38.0 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/145
* chore(deps): update dependency bazel to v7.3.0 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/147

* chore(deps): update dependency io_bazel_rules_go to v0.50.0 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/153
* chore(deps): update dependency io_bazel_rules_go to v0.50.1 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/154
* chore(deps): update dependency aspect_bazel_lib to v2.9.0 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/155
* chore(deps): update bazel-contrib/setup-bazel action to v0.9.0 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/158
* chore(deps): update dependency bazel_gazelle to v0.39.0 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/157
* chore(deps): update dependency aspect_bazel_lib to v2.9.1 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/159
* chore(deps): update dependency bazel to v7.3.2 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/160
* chore(deps): update dependency bazel_gazelle to v0.39.1 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/161
* chore(deps): update bazel-contrib/.github action to v7 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/162
* chore(deps): update dependency aspect_bazel_lib to v2.9.2 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/163
* chore: Handle + in canonical repo name by @honnix in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/164

## New Contributors
* @honnix made their first contribution in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/164

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/compare/v0.12.1...v0.12.2

## What's Changed

name: v0.12.0
body:
## Using Bzlmod with Bazel 7

1. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_ruby", version = "0.12.0")
```

## Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6

1. Enable with `common --enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_ruby", version = "0.12.0")
```

## Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your `WORKSPACE.bazel` file:

```starlark
load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

# Skylib is a dependency, remove if you already have it.
http_archive(
    name = "bazel_skylib",
    sha256 = "74d544d96f4a5bb630d465ca8bbcfe231e3594e5aae57e1edbf17a6eb3ca2506",
    urls = [
        "https://mirror.bazel.build/github.com/bazelbuild/bazel-skylib/releases/download/1.3.0/bazel-skylib-1.3.0.tar.gz",
        "https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel-skylib/releases/download/1.3.0/bazel-skylib-1.3.0.tar.gz",
    ],
)

http_archive(
    name = "rules_ruby",
    sha256 = "278047118bff94453a70243427afc82e2a8dd13f8a186c3e9103b3e8a3c08d5b",
    strip_prefix = "rules_ruby-0.12.0",
    url = "https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/releases/download/v0.12.0/rules_ruby-v0.12.0.tar.gz",
)
```


## What's Changed
* chore(deps): update bazel-contrib/setup-bazel action to v0.8.5 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/132
* add `--disable-install-doc` to Ruby configure args to speed up installation time by @timsutton in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/133
* chore(deps): update dependency io_bazel_rules_go to v0.48.1 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/135
* chore(deps): update dependency aspect_bazel_lib to v2.7.8 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/137
* chore(deps): update dependency bazel to v7.2.1 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/138
* chore(deps): update dependency io_bazel_rules_go to v0.49.0 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/139
* Support per-target Ruby toolchain by @sushain97 in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/140
* Set `$HOME` to `$TEST_TMPDIR` in test targets by @sushain97 in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/141

## New Contributors
* @timsutton made their first contribution in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/133

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/compare/v0.11.0...v0.12.0

body:

## Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6

## Using WORKSPACE

```starlark
load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

# Skylib is a dependency, remove if you already have it.
http_archive(
    name = "bazel_skylib",
    sha256 = "74d544d96f4a5bb630d465ca8bbcfe231e3594e5aae57e1edbf17a6eb3ca2506",
    urls = [
        "https://mirror.bazel.build/github.com/bazelbuild/bazel-skylib/releases/download/1.3.0/bazel-skylib-1.3.0.tar.gz",
        "https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel-skylib/releases/download/1.3.0/bazel-skylib-1.3.0.tar.gz",
    ],
)

http_archive(
    name = "rules_ruby",
    sha256 = "21e231f0a0adba5ec771a5c68221c12f2dddc132693abf764cb89fcd292e22e5",
    strip_prefix = "rules_ruby-0.11.0",
    url = "https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/releases/download/v0.11.0/rules_ruby-v0.11.0.tar.gz",
)
```


## What's Changed
* chore(deps): update dependency io_bazel_rules_go to v0.47.1 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/117
* chore(deps): update dependency aspect_bazel_lib to v2.7.3 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/118
* chore: sync `.bazelversion` files and disable lockfile by @p0deje in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/120
* chore(deps): update bazel-contrib/setup-bazel action to v0.8.4 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/121
* chore(deps): update dependency bazel to v7.1.2 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/119
* chore(deps): update dependency io_bazel_rules_go to v0.48.0 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/122
* chore(deps): update dependency aspect_bazel_lib to v2.7.6 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/124
* chore(deps): update dependency aspect_bazel_lib to v2.7.7 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/127
* chore(deps): update dependency bazel_skylib_gazelle_plugin to v1.7.0 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/129
* fix: properly locate OS-installed `system` Ruby by @p0deje in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/128
* chore(deps): update dependency bazel_skylib_gazelle_plugin to v1.7.1 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/130
* fix: propagate `ruby_build_version` under bzlmod by @p0deje in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/131


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/compare/v0.10.0...v0.11.0

## What's Changed
* fix: presubmit missing bazel propery by @p0deje in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/95
* ci: separate repository caches in examples by @p0deje in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/96
* fix: propagate Ruby toolchain files as inputs to `rb_gem_build` by @p0deje in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/94


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/compare/v0.8.0...v0.8.1

name: v0.8.0
body:
## Using Bzlmod with Bazel 7

1. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_ruby", version = "0.8.0")
```

## Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6

1. Enable with `common --enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_ruby", version = "0.8.0")
```

## Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your `WORKSPACE.bazel` file:

```starlark
load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

# Skylib is a dependency, remove if you already have it.
http_archive(
    name = "bazel_skylib",
    sha256 = "74d544d96f4a5bb630d465ca8bbcfe231e3594e5aae57e1edbf17a6eb3ca2506",
    urls = [
        "https://mirror.bazel.build/github.com/bazelbuild/bazel-skylib/releases/download/1.3.0/bazel-skylib-1.3.0.tar.gz",
        "https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel-skylib/releases/download/1.3.0/bazel-skylib-1.3.0.tar.gz",
    ],
)

http_archive(
    name = "rules_ruby",
    sha256 = "00ec03ad04ff1657362277e00a90a1b24616673005089aab6dcc664d42670c55",
    strip_prefix = "rules_ruby-0.8.0",
    url = "https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/releases/download/v0.8.0/rules_ruby-v0.8.0.tar.gz",
)
```


## What's Changed
* fix!: avoid overlapping output files in `rb_binary` by @p0deje in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/93
* chore: test module on bazel 6/7 by @p0deje in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/92


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/compare/v0.7.0...v0.8.0

name: v0.7.0
body:
- Adds bundler_remote attribute to rb_bundle_fetch() repository rule which allows to install bundler from a different location that [rubygems.org](http://rubygems.org/)
- Adds support for gems integrity in rb_bundle_fetch() repository rule via gem_checksums and bundler_checksums attributes. Checksums for bundler are shipped with the ruleset itself, so only need to overwrite if an unknown version is used or you use a custom bundler.
- Supports $(location ...)  expansion in env attribute of rb_binary() and rb_test() rules.
- Supports passing custom PATH in env attribute of rb_bundle_fetch() repository rule.

## Using Bzlmod with Bazel 7

1. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_ruby", version = "0.7.0")
```

## Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6

1. Enable with `common --enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_ruby", version = "0.7.0")
```

## Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your `WORKSPACE.bazel` file:

```starlark
load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

# Skylib is a dependency, remove if you already have it.
http_archive(
    name = "bazel_skylib",
    sha256 = "74d544d96f4a5bb630d465ca8bbcfe231e3594e5aae57e1edbf17a6eb3ca2506",
    urls = [
        "https://mirror.bazel.build/github.com/bazelbuild/bazel-skylib/releases/download/1.3.0/bazel-skylib-1.3.0.tar.gz",
        "https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel-skylib/releases/download/1.3.0/bazel-skylib-1.3.0.tar.gz",
    ],
)

http_archive(
    name = "rules_ruby",
    sha256 = "018c9dd8aa0746e989dfb5ef6bfc582ff29c20f28a1444370990b6408cd6d646",
    strip_prefix = "rules_ruby-0.7.0",
    url = "https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/releases/download/v0.7.0/rules_ruby-v0.7.0.tar.gz",
)
```


## What's Changed
* chore(deps): update dependency bazel to v7.0.2 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/71
* chore(deps): update dependency aspect_bazel_lib to v2.4.1 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/75
* chore(deps): update p0deje/setup-bazel action to v0.5.0 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/76
* chore(deps): update dependency io_bazel_rules_go to v0.46.0 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/77
* add an example jekyll site by @RyanDraves in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/74
* chore(deps): update p0deje/setup-bazel action to v0.5.0 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/78
* chore(deps): update p0deje/setup-bazel action to v0.6.0 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/79
* chore(deps): update dependency aspect_bazel_lib to v2.4.2 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/80
* Add `bundler_remote` attribute to `rb_bundle_fetch` by @sushain97 in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/81
* Add bundler checksums by @sushain97 in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/83
* Actually use the bundler checksum by @sushain97 in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/84
* chore(deps): update dependency aspect_bazel_lib to v2.5.0 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/85
* chore(deps): update bazel-contrib/.github action to v6 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/86
* Support providing integrity for gem downloads by @sushain97 in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/82
* chore: enable repository-cache in setup-bazel by @p0deje in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/89
* chore(deps): update dependency aspect_bazel_lib to v2.5.1 by @renovate in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/90
* feat: allow customizing `$PATH` during `rb_bundle_fetch` by @sushain97 in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/91
* feat: support using `$(location)` in env attribute by @p0deje in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/87

## New Contributors
* @RyanDraves made their first contribution in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/74
* @sushain97 made their first contribution in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/pull/81

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_ruby/compare/v0.6.0...v0.7.0

name: v0.1.1
body:
## Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6

1. Enable with `common --enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_ruby", version = "0.1.1")
```

## Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your `WORKSPACE.bazel` file:

```starlark

    name = "rules_ruby",
    sha256 = "813963323ef591731993d1d7ee8dba6ac80064a46c290f1561559c1e433152dd",
    strip_prefix = "rules_ruby-0.1.1",
    url = "https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/releases/download/v0.1.1/rules_ruby-v0.1.1.tar.gz",
)
```


## What's Changed
* lazily download ruby toolchain by @jgao54 in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/4
* support `rb_binary` with Gemfiles in subdirectory by @jgao54 in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/8
* Propagate bundle envs from rb_bundle to rb_binary by @jgao54 in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/10
* chore: add a .bazelversion file by @alexeagle in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/11
* chore: extend timeout for some tests by @alexeagle in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/20
* chore: introduce buildifier format/linter for starlark by @alexeagle in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/18
* chore: automate releases by @alexeagle in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/13
* chore: check buildifier on CI by @alexeagle in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/21
* feat: support bzlmod by @alexeagle in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/17
* chore: add bazelrc for CI by @alexeagle in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/24

## New Contributors
* @jgao54 made their first contribution in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/4
* @alexeagle made their first contribution in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/11

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/commits/v0.1.1

name: v0.1.0
body:
## Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6

1. Enable with `common --enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_ruby", version = "0.1.0")
```

## Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your `WORKSPACE.bazel` file:

```starlark
load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")
http_archive(
    name = "rules_ruby",
    sha256 = "3cd131af2865a008714aabb56c1db06f17bc1faaeca8d53322fe81da4d0ae01d",
    strip_prefix = "rules_ruby-0.1.0",
    url = "https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/releases/download/v0.1.0/rules_ruby-v0.1.0.tar.gz",
)
```


## What's Changed
* lazily download ruby toolchain by @jgao54 in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/4
* support `rb_binary` with Gemfiles in subdirectory by @jgao54 in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/8
* Propagate bundle envs from rb_bundle to rb_binary by @jgao54 in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/10
* chore: add a .bazelversion file by @alexeagle in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/11
* chore: extend timeout for some tests by @alexeagle in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/20
* chore: introduce buildifier format/linter for starlark by @alexeagle in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/18
* chore: automate releases by @alexeagle in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/13
* chore: check buildifier on CI by @alexeagle in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/21
* feat: support bzlmod by @alexeagle in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/17
* chore: add bazelrc for CI by @alexeagle in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/24

## New Contributors
* @jgao54 made their first contribution in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/4
* @alexeagle made their first contribution in https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/pull/11

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/p0deje/rules_ruby/commits/v0.1.0
